turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: Your brothers are upsetting the balance of good and evil.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What can I do about it?

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: You can't do jack shit... unless you learn your evil powers.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Nobody's as evil as my brothers. Those dudes put the wick in wicked.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: Go get a soda out of the fridge.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: But those are my roommate's sodas...

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: "But those are my roommate's sodas..." Does that sound like a statement the son of the devil would make?

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: You have the power to change the cola in that can into any other liquid -- engine oil, bat's blood, moose piss. You just have to release the evil within you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Release the evil?

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: I'm just saying, there's wickedness in you... I can tell from your snores.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: We had the greatest afternoon of my life until Adrian made me tell her she had a heart-shaped ass.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: Maybe you love her. But what do I know? I'm baked out of my mind.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I seem to be in trouble, Beefy.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: The shit has hit the fan, kid. Take a look.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I didn't murder anybody

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: Look. You were really high. Things happen.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I was with Valerie, I swear. This is Adrian's work. I've got to find him.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: I think you're looking at him.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: This is baloney!

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: He superimposed your head onto "Scarface."

turns.speaker: LUCIFER
turns.text: What's with all the whoo-whoo noises?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Everything's fine, pop.

turns.speaker: LUCIFER
turns.text: Last time you said that the renaissance happened.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Please, pop, just go back to your room.

turns.speaker: LUCIFER
turns.text: Can I take him with me and have sex with his head?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Sure, pop. Whatever you want.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I'm sorry. After careful consideration, I regretfully have to decline.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: C'mon, man, I'm just asking for one Superbowl ring.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: In exchange for eternal damnation of your soul? You're too nice of a guy for me to want to do that to you, Mr. Marino.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: You did it for Namath.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Yeah, but Joe was coming here anyways. Just go back to Earth and enjoy your records and the Hall of Fame and the beautiful family and all that.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: This is bullshit, man.  I'm gonna win the Superbowl this year, with or without you!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Now you're talking.

turns.speaker: JIMMY THE DEMON
turns.text: Knock, knock.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Yes, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: No, no, that's not what I said. He can keep his thumbs, but the fingers gotta go.

turns.speaker: JIMMY THE DEMON
turns.text: Oh, and don't forget, you're shoving a pineapple up Hitler's ass at four o'clock.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I got no ears! I can't hear!

turns.speaker: JIMMY THE DEMON
turns.text: Now he's got no ears! You happy, Nicky? Your father's got no ears!

turns.speaker: JIMMY THE DEMON
turns.text: Check one-two. Check one-two.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Put it back on my head. I'm falling apart here.

turns.speaker: JIMMY THE DEMON
turns.text: He's got 'til midnight tonight, Nicky.  You get your ass back up there. You save your father!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Nothing, Dad. Just re-arranging the furniture.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Cassius, didn't I tell you to stay out of your brother's mind?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Now everybody sit down.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey, Dad, I'm almost finished laying down my monsters of metal compilation tape. I really think it's a masterpiece.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Okay, kid, we'll listen to it later.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: This was a very difficult decision, because I have three wonderful sons. I mean, Adrian, so smart, so ruthless. And Cassius, so strong, so tough. And Nicky, so... so...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Don't worry about coming up with anything. It's cool.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Such a sweet boy. But after much thought and careful consideration, I've decided that the ruler for the next ten thousand years is going to have to be... me.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I mean... tough break.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: The important thing for the stability of our rule is to maintain the balance between good and evil. And I don't think any of you are ready for that responsibility yet. You need the wisdom that comes only with the passage of time.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Now that was an experience. "You are only coming through in waves." That line blows my mind every time.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Definitely.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I don't care what kind of mood you're in at the start of that song. When it's over, that mood has been altered. Wow. Great shit. What's next?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, I thought that after messing with your head, I'd give you a little kick in the keester.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Who is this, Metal-lick-a?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Metallica, Dad. Come on.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I was just playing with you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You're a good devil, Dad.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: And I also happen to be a Jets fan.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: This is bad, Nicky.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: How bad?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I'm gonna die, Nicky. If the gates are broken, no new souls can get in, which means I'll start to deteriorate into nothing.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: To do that Cassius and Adrian have to come back through the other way.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: So go get 'em, Dad!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I'm too weak. The process has already begun.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Nicky, the worst thing that could happen on Earth is you get killed, in which case, boom, you end up back here.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Are you telling me I have to go to Earth and kill my brothers?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No. This can't be happening.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Son, just do your best.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: That's a train, son. Don't stand in front of them.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, I guess I'm going to have to take a mulligan on this one.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Please, Nicky, get back up there.  Try to hurry.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Dad, Adrian's got the whole city after me. He's always a step ahead. What am I gonna do?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: What are you gonna do? Look at me, Nicky! I got no legs, I got no hips, I got one ear...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Uh, I'll do my best, Dad. Do you have any advice at all for me?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I can't hear you, Nicky. I can't hear anything!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: You came through, Nicky.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I came through for you, Mom and the butterflies, Dad.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: You're back in Hell now, kid. There's no butterflies here. If you want butterflies, you need to be on Earth.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What about you and Grandpa and everyone in Hell?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Nicky, I let my butterflies die once upon a time and it's never stopped hurting.  That's right, you heard me, Holly. I'm still in love with you.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Listen, I got down low. Your mom's got up high. You take care of the middle.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I will, Dad. But in the words of Motley Crue, this will always be my... home sweet home...

turns.speaker: GATEKEEPER
turns.text: I'm lucky to get away with just the head boobs, right?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Coulda been much worse.

turns.speaker: GATEKEEPER
turns.text: That's what I'm thinkin'...

turns.speaker: GATEKEEPER
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: That's a pretty brassiere.

turns.speaker: GATEKEEPER
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Could you maybe not tell anyone about this?

turns.speaker: GATEKEEPER
turns.text: You got it. Could you maybe not tell anyone about this?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: GATEKEEPER
turns.text: Bus?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Beast.

turns.speaker: LUCIFER
turns.text: You know, I was the one who created Hell.

turns.speaker: GATEKEEPER
turns.text: I know, your wickedness.

turns.speaker: LUCIFER
turns.text: I started slow, though. For years, I was just giving people hot foots. Actually, you can give all the credit for Hell to my first wife; she was the inspiration. She was an ugly one, too. One day, she asked me if I wanted super sex. I said I'll take the soup.

turns.speaker: LUCIFER
turns.text: You know what was in Hell when I came down here, Cassius?

turns.speaker: GATEKEEPER
turns.text: It's Stanley, sir.

turns.speaker: LUCIFER
turns.text: Nothing. No mountains. No castles. Looked like a giant parking lot. It wasn't even called Hell.

turns.speaker: GATEKEEPER
turns.text: What was it called, sir.

turns.speaker: LUCIFER
turns.text: Boogerland!

turns.speaker: GATEKEEPER
turns.text: That's nice, Grandpa. Why don't you just enjoy the fishing?

turns.speaker: LUCIFER
turns.text: I can't enjoy anything. I go fishing. I catch nothing. I go to orgies, I catch everything...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey...

turns.speaker: JIMMY THE DEMON
turns.text: Your father wants to see you and your brothers in the throne room.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Okay, but Jimmy, when the house is rockin', don't forget the knockin'!

turns.speaker: JIMMY THE DEMON
turns.text: Nothing's getting through that. The fire is solid as a rock.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: We gotta get this bad boy burning again. Ideas?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: So go get 'em, Jimmy!

turns.speaker: JIMMY THE DEMON
turns.text: I'm just a demon, Nicky. I don't got devil blood in me. I'd last two minutes up there with your brothers.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You're not saying it's up to me?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I've never been to Earth. I've never even slept over at some other dude's house!

turns.speaker: JIMMY THE DEMON
turns.text: You're the spawn of Satan. You got it in you.

turns.speaker: JIMMY THE DEMON
turns.text: You were gone ten seconds. What happened?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I got hit by a big light that was attached to a lot of metal.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No wonder your uncle's so weird...

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: I gotta say this cake tastes a little funny.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: I was in love one time but she said I wasn't financially reliable enough. And she needed that.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: By she, do you mean he?

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Easy, Liberace.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Oh, would you grow up.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: His name is Andrew. I know that guy.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Of course you do, Tommy Tune.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Sounds like our devil dance actually worked this time.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: 'Bout time...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: There's our man.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Mr. Sleepyhead must have some major ties to the dark side.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What's with that guy?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Gotta be one of his disciples or something.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yo, man, I think that devil guy just got ripped off.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Should we wake him up?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah. You do it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Did you check out the dragon mouth?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: The Dark Prince is here.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Look who's back from the dead.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Six, six, six, pick up sticks.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's a big pass, Elton John.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We're going to see Ozzy play at the Meadowlands, right now. Wanna come, Nicky?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You sure you're down with this?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Little nervous. Wanna puke.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Looking for the chief.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We know where to find Nicky.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Schnapps...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Peppermint... alright.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: This don't look good.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Can't Beefy use his penis powers to get us out of this?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Which way did he go?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That way.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What's Ozzy trying to say there?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Absolutely nothing. The Blizzard always came straight with his messages. But wrap your minds around this one.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Come on. One more time.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Not again, fellas. It kind of hurts.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No thanks. I'm afraid I wouldn't be able to give Ozzy the focus he deserves.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Whoa, that chick must be the real deal, then. Later on.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: See ya, fellas.

turns.speaker: REGIS
turns.text: So I was driving to work today, and some bozo in a Cadillac cut me off...

turns.speaker: KATHY LEE
turns.text: Oh, that's terrible, Reege...

turns.speaker: REGIS
turns.text: So I followed him...

turns.speaker: KATHY LEE
turns.text: You followed him?

turns.speaker: REGIS
turns.text: I followed him all the way downtown, and when he gets out of the car, I reach under my seat and pull out an aluminum bat.

turns.speaker: KATHY LEE
turns.text: You keep a bat under your seat?

turns.speaker: REGIS
turns.text: Recently, yes! So I run up behind this guy, and start bashing his brains in with this bat, and it made me feel happy! Did you ever see THE UNTOUCHABLES?

turns.speaker: KATHY LEE
turns.text: Yes, great movie...

turns.speaker: REGIS
turns.text: I was DeNiro!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Please. You got to.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: All right...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'm not Nicky. I'm not home! I don't live here!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Dude, it's us. Let us in.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Good idea... kill me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Dude. Seriously?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yes. I'll meet you at Grand Central at noon. Okay. Do me. I command you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You gotta kill yourself.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'll just go to Heaven.

turns.speaker: STUDENT
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You smell like coconuts.

turns.speaker: STUDENT
turns.text: It's "Comptoir Sud Pacific." Makes me feel like a hula girl. Which is kinda what I'm going for. Wanna come in?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No thanks. I'm looking for a girl named Valerie who also smells like coconuts.

turns.speaker: STUDENT
turns.text: Valerie Doran? Two floors up, one window over.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Thanks, much. Good luck with the genital tucking.

turns.speaker: STUDENT
turns.text: I don't need luck. I'm good.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Adrian?

turns.speaker: STUDENT
turns.text: Andrew.

turns.speaker: STUDENT
turns.text: You got the wrong window again, man.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Oh. Sorry, Andrew. Valerie?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: That was amazing. Thanks so much. You didn't have to do that.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: That's okay. I get messed with all the time and when I saw him doing that to you I just lost it. I hate when people take advantage of tourists. It ruins it for the rest of us.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You think I'm a tourist?

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: I'm sorry. I just assumed. Your accent maybe. Where are you from?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: The South.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah. Deep south.  She laughs along with him, not sure why.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Why are you laughing?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I don't know, but I like it. Say. Your glasses are nice. They make your eyes look sparkly and big. It's fun to look at them.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: My dad's an optometrist.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: My dad's in hell, and he's falling apart.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: I'm sorry. It's really tough when your parents get older.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: If I don't save him, I don't know what I'm gonna do.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Well, I'm sure a nice southern boy like you will figure something out.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Here, have a Popeye's. This drumstick ain't for beatin' it's for eatin'.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: That's alright. I already ate lunch. I actually wouldn't mind getting a Gelati.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Could I come with you to getting a Gelati?

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: If you want to.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Want to? A million angry octopus people couldn't hold me back!

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: "Octopus people?"

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Uh, it's a deep south expression.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It's freezing my hands.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: It's not that cold. Here, let me wrap it.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: This town is really going to hell lately.  So what part of the city do you live in?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I have an apartment. I don't remember exactly where. My dog knows, though.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: You have a dog? What kind?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'm not sure. I'd ask him, but he's uptown talking to his contacts.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: I'd love to have a dog. But I go to school full time. It wouldn't be fair to the dog.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: School?

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Parsons School of Design. I knew growing up I wasn't much to look at, so I put my energy into making things that are pretty.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What's that pleasant smell coming from, your skin?

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: My perfume?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Valerie, it feels like there's a bunch of butterflies flapping around in my stomach. Is that normal?

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Sometimes, sure.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Good. I was concerned.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: So you're saying, make all pants with a drawstring, then heavier set gals don't have to feel humiliated by telling their waist size in front of the whole store?

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Basically, yeah.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Wow. Maybe you should make drawstring socks for gals with fat ankles.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: You know what's nice about you? You just seem happy being yourself. You don't try to act cool.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Thanks much. You know what's nice about you, Valerie?

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Your juicy, heart-shaped ass.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I... I don't know why I just said that. I meant to say that...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Nicky? Oh my God. Stay right there.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: What were you thinking coming here?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'm not sure, but it didn't involve getting blinded with poison.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Valerie?

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Are you dead?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I think I'm floating.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Why would you be floating?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe it's because of your sweet voice.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Am I supposed to not be freaked out right now? Because I am.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Look, just because you're floating doesn't mean I'm gonna forget about you giving me the finger.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: That wasn't me. I was being possessed by my brother, Adrian. He's the one who call you a gross pig.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: What do you mean, "possessed?"

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Remember when I told you my Dad was in Hell?

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, that's because he's the Devil. And he wants to keep his throne for another ten-thousand years. Which is fine with me, but not with my brothers, so they broke out of Hell, causing my dad...

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: ..."The Devil?"...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...to decompose. And I love my Dad very much. So I came to Earth to save him but then crazy eyes stole my flask and I met you and... well, my dog tells me I just might be in love with you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You gotta believe me. You gotta believe in the butterflies.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Okay, I do. Get back up here.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Can we go fly over Central Park?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Next time. Tonight, I want to share the most beautiful thing I could possibly imagine.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: We're going to Jersey?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: East Rutherford.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I never thought I'd ever see Ozzy live until he was dead.  Please tell me you like metal.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: "Mister Crowley, what's inside of your head..."

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Don't do it.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I have to, Valerie.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Nicky!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: That was Cassius!

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Where'd a sweet Southern boy learn to fight like that?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: From my dad's side of the family.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Do me.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hello, friend, my name is Nicky. I understand you're seeking a roommate, as per your advertisement in the Village Voice. Would it be possible for me to fill the slot?

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Uh, don't you want to know what the rent is?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yes. What is rent?

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Eight-hundred, split down the middle. Tuesdays and Thursdays I rehearse with my scene partner so the living room will be off limits.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Off limits.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Right. And as far as household items: we can share the soap, but we'll split the cost 60/40. Cause the person who physically goes out and buys the soap shouldn't have to pay as much as the other guy.  Aren't you boiling in that outfit?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: It's like eighty degrees in this hallway. You from the South?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah. The deep South.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Why is that funny?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: And sorry, man, but no dogs allowed.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It looks like the work of a brother...

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: A black guy?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: If it's Cassius, yes.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: A little strange. I can't stop thinking about this girl, Valerie.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Why? Did she hurt you? Do you miss her? Need a shoulder to cry on?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: That just hurt a lot.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: I've always wanted to kill someone. Can I do it?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey...

turns.speaker: STREET VENDOR
turns.text: See something you like, my man?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yes. I would like my flask back.

turns.speaker: STREET VENDOR
turns.text: You callin' me a thief, my man?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No, I'm just calling you... a guy who has my flask.

turns.speaker: STREET VENDOR
turns.text: And if that is your so-called "flask," how would I have it unless I was, in fact, a thief?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I don't know?

turns.speaker: STREET VENDOR
turns.text: Okay, now you gone and done it. You done messed with my business bitch!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Sir, I would prefer if you didn't raise your voice. It's making my muscles tighten.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I'm a Sandman!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I cut up a Sandman yesterday. They said I'd never get him... but I cut him up good, I did.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I feel sorry for you, boy!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: For me? Better feel sorry for yourself, Sandman!

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: No, for you! How old are you, Billy?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Fourteen? Fifteen? Your days are running out. How long can you last? A year. Six months?  What happens when you're sixteen and you go green?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Nothing will happen! I make the rules as I go!! Cubs do what I say! Always have! Always will! I got Cathedral and I'll never let go!

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: No cubs over fifteen, Billy! Ever heard of a cub with a green flower? You'll leave Cathedral then, Billy, when you're on green, because they won't let a green stay here.  If you try to stay the young ones will gut-rip you apart!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Shut up! Shut up your damn mouth!

turns.speaker: BOX
turns.text: Are you too startled? Am I too removed from your ken?  I'm neither machine nor man... but a perfect fusion of the two... and better than either.  No human sculptor could match this greatness... don't you agree?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: All right -- what are you?

turns.speaker: BOX
turns.text: Your turn.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: We're hungry do you have anything to eat?

turns.speaker: BOX
turns.text: Anything to eat?
